oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Letter from Captain A.D. Norris, Co. K, 7th Tenn. Inf. Regt., CSA to his family
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Letter from Captain A.D. Norris, Co. K, 7th Tenn. Inf. Regt., CSA to his family. He writes of soldiers working on fortifications near the Rappahannock and regiments going on picket. He says "The Yankees and our troops are scarcely enemies on the banks of; the Rappahannock as they stand in plain view of each other and frequently engage in conversation across the narrow stream." He writes of a vacancy in his company and the recommendation of the son of Pres. Anderson of Cumberland Univ. for the post.
